intro: Weberbauera perforata, commonly known as the perforate weberbauer, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive perforation pattern. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Weberbauera perforata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
